$$
Answer: Consider some tuple $t$ in $u$ 
Note that $r_{i}=\Pi_{R_{i}}(u)$ implies that $t[R_{i}]\in r_{i},1\le i\le n$ Thus, 
$$
t[R_{1}]\bowtie t[R_{2}]\bowtie\dotsc\bowtie t[R_{n}]\in r_{1}\bowtie r_{2}\bowtie\dotsc\bowtie r_{n}
$$
By the definition of natural join, 
$$
t[R_{1}]\bowtie t[R_{2}]\bowtie...\bowtie t[R_{n}]=\Pi_{\alpha}\left(\sigma_{\beta}\left(t[R_{1}]\times t[R_{2}]\times...\times t[R_{n}]\right)\right)
